member.name: M:MySql.Web.Security.CustomInstaller.Install(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, performs the installation.
member.param: An used to save information needed to perform a commit, rollback, or uninstall operation.
member.exception: An exception occurred in the event handler of one of the installers in the collection. -or- An exception occurred in the event handler of one of the installers in the collection.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Security.CustomInstaller.Uninstall(System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, removes an installation.
member.param: An that contains the state of the computer after the installation was complete.
member.exception: The saved-state might have been corrupted.
An exception occurred while uninstalling. This exception is ignored and the uninstall continues. However, the application might not be fully uninstalled after the uninstallation completes.

member.name: T:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider
member.summary: Manages storage of membership information for an ASP.NET application in a MySQL database.

remarks.para: This class is used by the and classes to provide membership services for ASP.NET applications using a MySQL database.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.Initialize(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes the MySQL membership provider with the property values specified in the ASP.NET application's configuration file. This method is not intended to be used directly from your code.
member.param: The name of the instance to initialize.
A collection of the name/value pairs representing the provider-specific attributes specified in the configuration for this provider.
member.exception: An attempt is made to call on a provider after the provider has already been initialized.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.ApplicationName
member.summary: The name of the application using the MySQL membership provider.
member.value: The name of the application using the MySQL membership provider. The default is the application virtual path.
member.remarks: The ApplicationName is used by the MySqlMembershipProvider to separate membership information for multiple applications. Using different application names, applications can use the same membership database. Likewise, multiple applications can make use of the same membership data by simply using the same application name. Caution should be taken with multiple applications as the ApplicationName property is not thread safe during writes.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file. The application name setting is being used.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.EnablePasswordReset
member.summary: Indicates whether the membership provider is configured to allow users to reset their passwords.
member.value: true if the membership provider supports password reset; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: Allows the user to replace their password with a new, randomly generated password. This can be especially handy when using hashed passwords since hashed passwords cannot be retrieved.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.EnablePasswordRetrieval
member.summary: Indicates whether the membership provider is configured to allow users to retrieve their passwords.
member.value: true if the membership provider is configured to support password retrieval; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: If the system is configured to use hashed passwords, then retrieval is not possible. If the user attempts to initialize the provider with hashed passwords and enable password retrieval set to true then a is thrown.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.RequiresQuestionAndAnswer
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the membership provider is configured to require the user to answer a password question for password reset and retrieval.
member.value: true if a password answer is required for password reset and retrieval; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.RequiresUniqueEmail
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the membership provider is configured to require a unique e-mail address for each user name.
member.value: true if the membership provider requires a unique e-mail address; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.MaxInvalidPasswordAttempts
member.summary: Gets the number of invalid password or password-answer attempts allowed before the membership user is locked out.
member.value: The number of invalid password or password-answer attempts allowed before the membership user is locked out.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.PasswordAttemptWindow
member.summary: Gets the number of minutes in which a maximum number of invalid password or password-answer attempts are allowed before the membership user is locked out.
member.value: The number of minutes in which a maximum number of invalid password or password-answer attempts are allowed before the membership user is locked out.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.PasswordFormat
member.summary: Gets a value indicating the format for storing passwords in the membership data store.
member.value: One of the values indicating the format for storing passwords in the data store.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.MinRequiredNonAlphanumericCharacters
member.summary: Gets the minimum number of special characters that must be present in a valid password.
member.value: The minimum number of special characters that must be present in a valid password.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.MinRequiredPasswordLength
member.summary: Gets the minimum length required for a password.
member.value: The minimum length required for a password.
member.example: The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.PasswordStrengthRegularExpression
member.summary: Gets the regular expression used to evaluate a password.
member.value: A regular expression used to evaluate a password.
member.example:
The following example shows the membership element being used in an applications web.config file. In this example, the regular expression specifies that the password must meet the following criteria:
Is at least seven characters. Contains at least one digit. Contains at least one special (non-alphanumeric) character.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.WriteExceptionsToEventLog
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether exceptions are written to the event log.
member.value: true if exceptions should be written to the log; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.ChangePassword(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the password.
member.param: The username.
The old password.
The new password.
member.returns: true if the password was updated successfully, false if the supplied old password is invalid, the user is locked out, or the user does not exist in the database.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.ChangePasswordQuestionAndAnswer(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the password question and answer.
member.param: The username.
The password.
The new password question.
The new password answer.
member.returns: true if the update was successful; otherwise, false. A value of false is also returned if the password is incorrect, the user is locked out, or the user does not exist in the database.

member.summary: Adds a new membership user to the data source.
member.param: The user name for the new user.
The password for the new user.
The e-mail address for the new user.
The password question for the new user.
The password answer for the new user
Whether or not the new user is approved to be validated.
The unique identifier from the membership data source for the user.
A enumeration value indicating whether the user was created successfully.
member.returns: A object populated with the information for the newly created user.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.DeleteUser(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes a user from the membership data source.
member.param: The name of the user to delete.
true to delete data related to the user from the database; false to leave data related to the user in the database.
member.returns: true if the user was successfully deleted; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets a collection of all the users in the data source in pages of data.

The size of the page of results to return.
The total number of matched users.
member.returns: A collection that contains a page of objects beginning at the page specified by .

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.GetUser(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets information from the data source for a user. Provides an option to update the last-activity date/time stamp for the user.

true to update the last-activity date/time stamp for the user; false to return user information without updating the last-activity date/time stamp for the user.
member.returns: A object populated with the specified user's information from the data source.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Security.MySQLMembershipProvider.GetUser(System.Object,System.Boolean)

true to update the last-activity date/time stamp for the user; false to return user information without updating the last-activity date/time stamp for the user.
member.returns: A object populated with the specified user's information from the data source.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, deletes all user-profile data for profiles in which the last activity date occurred before the specified date.
member.param:
One of the
values, specifying whether anonymous, authenticated, or both types of profiles are deleted.

A that identifies which user profiles are considered inactive. If the
value of a user profile occurs on or before this date and time, the profile is considered inactive.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Profile.MySQLProfileProvider.FindInactiveProfilesByUserName(System.Web.Profile.ProfileAuthenticationOption,System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, retrieves profile information for profiles in which the last activity date occurred on or before the specified date and the user name matches the specified user name.
member.param: One of the values, specifying whether anonymous, authenticated, or both types of profiles are returned.
The user name to search for.
A that identifies which user profiles are considered inactive. If the value of a user profile occurs on or before this date and time, the profile is considered inactive.
The index of the page of results to return.
The size of the page of results to return.
When this method returns, contains the total number of profiles.
member.returns: A containing user profile information for inactive profiles where the user name matches the supplied parameter.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Profile.MySQLProfileProvider.FindProfilesByUserName(System.Web.Profile.ProfileAuthenticationOption,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, retrieves profile information for profiles in which the user name matches the specified user names.
member.param: One of the values, specifying whether anonymous, authenticated, or both types of profiles are returned.
The user name to search for.
The index of the page of results to return.
The size of the page of results to return.
When this method returns, contains the total number of profiles.
member.returns: A containing user-profile information for profiles where the user name matches the supplied parameter.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Profile.MySQLProfileProvider.GetAllInactiveProfiles(System.Web.Profile.ProfileAuthenticationOption,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, retrieves user-profile data from the data source for profiles in which the last activity date occurred on or before the specified date.
member.param: One of the values, specifying whether anonymous, authenticated, or both types of profiles are returned.
A that identifies which user profiles are considered inactive. If the of a user profile occurs on or before this date and time, the profile is considered inactive.
The index of the page of results to return.
The size of the page of results to return.
When this method returns, contains the total number of profiles.
member.returns: A containing user-profile information about the inactive profiles.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Profile.MySQLProfileProvider.GetAllProfiles(System.Web.Profile.ProfileAuthenticationOption,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, retrieves user profile data for all profiles in the data source.
member.param: One of the values, specifying whether anonymous, authenticated, or both types of profiles are returned.
The index of the page of results to return.
The size of the page of results to return.
When this method returns, contains the total number of profiles.
member.returns: A containing user-profile information for all profiles in the data source.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Profile.MySQLProfileProvider.GetNumberOfInactiveProfiles(System.Web.Profile.ProfileAuthenticationOption,System.DateTime)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the number of profiles in which the last activity date occurred on or before the specified date.
member.param: One of the values, specifying whether anonymous, authenticated, or both types of profiles are returned.
A that identifies which user profiles are considered inactive. If the of a user profile occurs on or before this date and time, the profile is considered inactive.
member.returns: The number of profiles in which the last activity date occurred on or before the specified date.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.Profile.MySQLProfileProvider.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the currently running application.
member.returns: A that contains the application's shortened name, which does not contain a full path or extension, for example, SimpleAppSettings.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Profile.MySQLProfileProvider.GetPropertyValues(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyCollection)
member.summary: Returns the collection of settings property values for the specified application instance and settings property group.
member.param: A describing the current application use.
A containing the settings property group whose values are to be retrieved.
member.returns: A containing the values for the specified settings property group.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.Profile.MySQLProfileProvider.SetPropertyValues(System.Configuration.SettingsContext,System.Configuration.SettingsPropertyValueCollection)
member.summary: Sets the values of the specified group of property settings.
member.param: A describing the current application usage.
A representing the group of property settings to set.

member.name: T:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore
member.summary: This class allows ASP.NET applications to store and manage session state information in a MySQL database. Expired session data is periodically deleted from the database.

member.name: P:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.EnableExpireCallback
member.summary: Indicates whether if expire callback is on or off

member.name: P:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.WriteExceptionsToEventLog
member.summary: Indicates whether to write exceptions to event log

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.HandleMySqlException(MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlException,System.String)
member.summary: Handles MySql exception. If WriteExceptionsToEventLog is set, will write exception info to event log. It throws provider exception (original exception is stored as inner exception)
member.param: exception
name of the function that throwed the exception

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.Initialize(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes the provider with the property values specified in the ASP.NET application configuration file
member.param: The name of the provider instance to initialize.
Object that contains the names and values of configuration options for the provider.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.CreateNewStoreData(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method creates a new SessionStateStoreData object for the current request.
member.param: The HttpContext object for the current request.
The timeout value (in minutes) for the SessionStateStoreData object that is created.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.CreateUninitializedItem(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method adds a new session state item to the database.
member.param: The HttpContext object for the current request.
The session ID for the current request.
The timeout value for the current request.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.Dispose
member.summary: This method releases all the resources for this instance.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.EndRequest(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: This method allows the MySqlSessionStateStore object to perform any cleanup that may be required for the current request.
member.param: The HttpContext object for the current request

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.GetItem(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Boolean@,System.TimeSpan@,System.Object@,System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions@)
member.summary: This method returns a read-only session item from the database.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.GetItemExclusive(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Boolean@,System.TimeSpan@,System.Object@,System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions@)
member.summary: This method locks a session item and returns it from the database
member.param: The HttpContext object for the current request
The session ID for the current request
true if the session item is locked in the database; otherwise, it is false.
TimeSpan object that indicates the amount of time the session item has been locked in the database.
A lock identifier object.
A SessionStateActions enumeration value that indicates whether or not the session is uninitialized and cookieless.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.InitializeRequest(System.Web.HttpContext)
member.summary: This method performs any per-request initializations that the MySqlSessionStateStore provider requires.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.ReleaseItemExclusive(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method forcibly releases the lock on a session item in the database, if multiple attempts to retrieve the session item fail.
member.param: The HttpContext object for the current request.
The session ID for the current request.
The lock identifier for the current request.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.RemoveItem(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Object,System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData)
member.summary: This method removes the specified session item from the database
member.param: The HttpContext object for the current request
The session ID for the current request
The lock identifier for the current request.
The session item to remove from the database.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.ResetItemTimeout(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String)
member.summary: This method resets the expiration date and timeout for a session item in the database.
member.param: The HttpContext object for the current request
The session ID for the current request

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.SetAndReleaseItemExclusive(System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This method updates the session time information in the database with the specified session item, and releases the lock.
member.param: The HttpContext object for the current request
The session ID for the current request
The session item containing new values to update the session item in the database with.
The lock identifier for the current request.
A Boolean value that indicates whether or not the session item is new in the database. A false value indicates an existing item.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.GetSessionStoreItem(System.Boolean,System.Web.HttpContext,System.String,System.Boolean@,System.TimeSpan@,System.Object@,System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateActions@)
member.summary: GetSessionStoreItem is called by both the GetItem and GetItemExclusive methods. GetSessionStoreItem retrieves the session data from the data source. If the lockRecord parameter is true (in the case of GetItemExclusive), then GetSessionStoreItem locks the record and sets a New LockId and LockDate.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.SetItemExpireCallback(System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemExpireCallback)
member.summary: This method sets the reference for the ExpireCallback delegate if setting is enabled.
member.returns: false

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.Serialize(System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemCollection)
member.summary: Serialize is called by the SetAndReleaseItemExclusive method to convert the SessionStateItemCollection into a byte array to be stored in the blob field.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.Deserialize(System.Web.HttpContext,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Deserialize is called by the GetSessionStoreItem method to convert the byte array stored in the blob field to a SessionStateItemCollection.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SessionState.MySqlSessionStateStore.CheckStorageEngine(MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlConnection)
member.summary: Check storage engine used by my_aspnet_sessions. Warn if MyISAM is used - it does not handle concurrent updates well which is important for session provider, as each access to session does an update to "expires" field.

member.name: T:MySql.Web.SiteMap.MySqlSiteMapProvider
member.summary: SiteMap provider backed by MySql database.

member.name: M:MySql.Web.SiteMap.MySqlSiteMapProvider.HandleMySqlException(MySql.Data.MySqlClient.MySqlException,System.String)
member.summary: Handles MySql exception. If WriteExceptionsToEventLog is set, will write exception info to event log. It throws provider exception (original exception is stored as inner exception)
member.param: exception
name of the function that throwed the exception
